Class Simulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • Simulation

  • public class Simulation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a simulation of a single-line, single-server system and also handles all the details of the simulation. In this class you can add customers, serve customers, get information on the current customer and also information on the line. Finally, it can also return certain statistics that were maintained since the creation of the simulation.
    Author:
    Nick Sosinski, Jake Ira

    • Constructor Detail

      • Simulation

        public Simulation()

    • Method Detail

      • addCustomer

        public boolean addCustomer(Customer inCustomer)
        This method is called to add a person to the simulation. If the queue is full, it sends the customer away. If the queue is not full, it adds it to the queue unless there is nobody being served, in which case it places the customer at the mercy of the the server.
        Parameters:
        inCustomer - The customer to be added to the simulation.
        Returns:
        A boolean value of true if the customer was added or false if they weren't added.

      • serveCustomer

        public void serveCustomer()
        This method is called to serve the next customer in the queue. If there is no customer, it sets curServed to null. If there is customer(s) in the queue, then it removes the next one and sets it to curServed. It also increments the number of people that had to wait in the queue when the customer is removed. It adds the customers wait time to the sumOfWaitTime. Finally, it increments the number of customers served.

      • advanceTime

        public boolean advanceTime(int time)
        This method increments time by time units.
        Parameters:
        time - The number of units to add to time.
        Returns:
        A boolean of true if time was incremented, or false if the request was denied.

      • curCustomer

        public java.lang.String curCustomer()
        If the server is helping a customer, this method returns as string representation of curServed, otherwise if no customer is being served, it returns "none".
        Returns:
        A string containing either information about the customer or "none" indicating there is no customer being served currently.

      • isHelpingCustomer

        public boolean isHelpingCustomer()
        This method returns a boolean value of true if the server is helping a customer, or false if not.
        Returns:
        A boolean value of true if the server is helping a customer, or false if not.

      • totalWaitTime

        public int totalWaitTime()
        This method returns the sum of the total wait time.
        Returns:
        An integer value representing the sum of the wait time.

      • calculateAverageWait

        public double calculateAverageWait()
        This calculates the average wait time of the people that had to wait, or 0 if nobody waited.
        Returns:
        A double value representing the average wait time of customers that had to wait.

      • numWithNoWait

        public int numWithNoWait()
        This method returns the number of people that didn't need to wait.
        Returns:
        An integer value representing the number of people that didn't need to wait.

      • numServed

        public int numServed()
        This method returns the number of people that were served.
        Returns:
        An integer value representing the number of people that were served.

      • getTime

        public int getTime()
        This method returns the current time.
        Returns:
        An integer value representing the current time.

      • numWaiting

        public int numWaiting()
        This method returns the number of customers waiting in the queue.
        Returns:
        An integer value representing the number of customers waiting in the queue.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This method tests the public and private methods of the simulation class.
        Parameters:
        args - The command line arguments. (not used).
